project_description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating the Cubit pattern for state management. The app displays a text that toggles between 'Cat' (with a clock icon) and 'Dog' (with a person icon) upon clicking.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular architecture with a clear separation of concerns. It uses the Cubit pattern for state management, separating business logic from UI components.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen : launch()
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit : getInitialAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> HomeScreen : provideAnimalState()
User -> AnimalWidget : click()
AnimalWidget -> AnimalCubit : toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> HomeScreen : provideAnimalState()
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the AnimalCubit. The HomeScreen initializes and listens to the AnimalCubit for state changes. When the AnimalWidget is clicked, it calls the toggleAnimal method on the AnimalCubit, which toggles the state between Cat and Dog and notifies listeners of the change.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen (HomeScreen) and does not involve any complex navigation structure. The HomeScreen contains the main UI components and interacts with the AnimalCubit for state management.
